file_content.text: I'll take care of everything! No worries!
Please don't kill me! I beg you! I don't want to die!
I'll... I'll transfer a large sum of credits to your account! And I'll blame the Cathar for everything!
Just please don't kill me! For the love of the Emperor, let me live!
Calm down.
I can't stand to see a grown Imperial cry.
Fine, now stop bawling.
Oh, thank you! You'll find I'm a valuable ally! Yes! You won't regret this!
Thanks for the payoff.
Yes! Yes, it was a true pleasure! I'll never forget you! Never....
If I ever do, I'll find you.
See that I don't.
I'll never give you a reason to be unhappy! Never never never....
You are truly a sniveling coward, Pirrell.
You spineless wretch.
Yes! Yes, I am! It's the truth! I'm nothing....
I'm not leaving any witnesses.
Sorry. [Kill him]
Aaah! It hurts! It really hurts....
Can't say he didn't have it coming. Good riddance.
Did you know Murghir was the other bounty hunter all along?
I can't believe Murghir was an assassin! Thank the Emperor you were here to avenge the admiral!
I'll see to your reward personally! The governor of Balmorra himself will hear of your invaluable service to the Empire!
Can I count on your... discretion concerning my relationship with Murghir?
Your offer had better be especially generous.
I'm very expensive.
What if I'm implicated in this? I could be executed.
Discretion is dangerous.
I guarantee that won't happen! It was the Cathar, after all!
My silence can definitely be bought.
Sounds like a deal.
You'll be most pleased with your reward, my friend. You have my word!
And everyone will hear about your noble defense of the admiral. You'll be a hero of the Empire!
We're done here, Pirrell.
Whatever you say.
Yes, don't let me keep you.
I want songs written about me. Loud songs.
Don't heroes get celebrated?
Certainly! By only the finest Bith musicians.
Then it's a done deal.
It's been a singular honor meeting you.
I'll see to cleaning up this mess. Best of luck in your future endeavors, my friend. Farewell.
Can't believe we pulled that off. What a crazy hunt! Honestly, did you know Murghir was the other bounty hunter all along?
She never had me fooled for a second.
Absolutely.
Really? Can't put one over on you, huh?
To be honest, I had no clue.
Not in the slightest.
Never trust overly agreeable women. Well, except me.
Figured it out toward the end. Didn't want to spoil the surprise.
Eventually, yes.
Next time, clue me in.
Looks like we're done with beautiful Balmorra. We should get gone while the getting's still good.
Protect the admiral! Stop that Cathar assassin!
This cannot be happening! Don't kill me!
Ah, there you are. Just in time--Admiral Ivernus's shuttle has already arrived. I hope you're ready.
Relax, he's just a man.
Don't be nervous.
Yes, you're right. No different from me. Shh--he's coming.
I'm kinda nervous, actually.
Me, too.
Yes. Meeting an Imperial admiral can be a humbling experience. Here he comes....
You're the one who needs to be ready.
Are you joking?
Yes, quite right. Steady. Deep breath....
Admiral Ivernus, sir! I can't tell you what a singular honor and pleasure this is.
You worthless incompetent.
B--beg your pardon? W--what have I done, sir?
It's what you failed to do. You're in charge of intelligence. Colonel Sartius's failures are your failures.
No, sir! I warned Colonel Sartius there were many problems with his strategies--
Silence, you pathetic excuse for an officer. I've come all the way here just to see you executed in person.
No! Sir, I can explain! I just--you, bounty hunter! Help the admiral understand! Explain it to him!
Not really my line of work.
What happened to being assertive?
You spineless coward.
Keep talking, Pirrell. I'm really enjoying this.
And miss all the fun?
You brought some filthy alien bounty hunter with you, Pirrell? What were you thinking?
You brought a bounty hunter with you, Pirrell? What were you thinking?
Thinking is not one of Pirrell's strengths, Admiral.
What's this? Another disgusting bit of subhuman scum?
What in the Emperor's name is that?
Murghir! What...?
The name's Murghir, Admiral Ivernus. I'm a bounty hunter on the Great Hunt, and I'm here to kill you.
I was wondering when my competition would show up.
You're the other hunter?
Competition? Of course! Ha! Well played, hunter!
What's the Great Hunt?
I had feeling about you.
I knew it!
Really, you weren't taken in by my superb acting? "Murghir loves her master! Murghir lives to serve!"
Guards, blast them! All of them!
No! Not me! Aieee!
Watch out, she's an assassin!
Everyone protect the admiral!
Guards, kill her!
Die, Imperial scum!
Don't be late. We need to make a good impression on the admiral.
Meet me at the spaceport. Your presence as part of the grand entourage I present to Admiral Ivernus will make the occasion truly memorable.
Murghir wants to go! Murghir can be part of the occasion!
Oh, very well--but mind your place.
I'll see you at the admiral's docking bay, bounty hunter. Don't be late. A very bright future awaits us!
Success! I've just received word that Colonel Sartius has been placed under arrest. Under arrest!
If only I could've been there when Sartius led his men into that garbage transport, weapons drawn! Ha!
Murghir swoons in admiration for master.
This is priceless! Admiral Ivernus is already on his way. He wants us to meet at the spaceport.
You've done me a great service, bounty hunter. Credits feels insufficient. How can I better reward you?
I want to be there when you meet the man, see you get your reward.
I'd like to meet this admiral.
Yes. How fitting that the individual who helped me achieve my goals be at my side to greet the admiral.
I'm sure the admiral will overlook your... genetic makeup, when he hears of your skill.
And he'll enjoy meeting someone of your skill and ability. I think both of you would benefit.
Tell all your rich friends about me.
Spread my name.
My friend, I'll make sure your name is well-known among elite Imperial circles.
We'll have to downplay your alien bloodline, of course. We'll get you a nice helmet.
In fact, I'll introduce you to the admiral. I think he'll be quite eager to meet you.
Having plenty of money is never a bad thing.
I like credits.
I shall make you one of the richest bounty hunters in the galaxy.
Aliens like you rarely go far in the Empire, but the future naval attache to the governor of Balmorra could certainly use you.
The future naval attache to the governor of Balmorra will need individuals like you. I'm sure the admiral will agree.
Feel free to eliminate any traitorous Balmorran resistance fighters along the way.
I need one final, brilliant maneuver to arrange my face-to-face meeting with Admiral Ivernus--and I know just what to do.
Reports indicate that the Republic forces that stayed on Balmorra after we invaded are training resistance fighters at the Balmorran Arms Factory.
Let's wipe them out.
It's not that simple. They're dug-in at a location we're trying to take intact. Otherwise, we'd have exterminated them long ego.
Why doesn't the Empire just finish off the Republic forever?
How do they get away with it?
If only. There are complications because of their dug-in position and because, of course, of the colonel's complete incompetence!
At least those resistance fighters make your life more interesting?
Bet they keep you busy.
They're terrorists and criminals. If not for the Republic's aid, they'd be harmless.
The colonel has learned of a secret rendezvous between the resistance leaders and several offworld allies.
His spies planted a homing beacon aboard the resistance leaders' command shuttle. You're going to remove that beacon.
If I remove the homing beacon, the resistance leaders escape.
And help the resistance?
Only temporarily. I'll deal with the resistance once Colonel Sartius is out of my way.
When you say "remove," I hear "vaporize."
You mean destroy it.
No, no. The beacon must remain intact.
Don't I get to kill anybody?
The resistance stronghold where the shuttle is kept is heavily fortified. I'm sure you'll find it highly stimulating.
You will move the beacon from the shuttle to a garbage transport. The colonel will swoop in with his warships... to find nothing but garbage-sifting Ugnaughts.
The shuttle is in the spaceport at the fortified Balmorran Arms Factory. Be cautious.
You're alive! Magnificent! Frantic reports of Colicoid attacks are pouring in from all over the planet.
I've included a generous bonus with your payment. Colonel Sartius is going absolutely insane! Ha!
Once Sartius is removed from his position, Admiral Ivernus will certainly consider my application for a promotion. It's a flawless plan, don't you agree?
Do I look like someone who knows how to impress admirals?
Asking the wrong person.
Well, I am the most qualified. The admiral is a very intelligent man. My application will speak for itself.
But what if it doesn't? What if it doesn't?
Bounty hunter, though clearly unlearned in these things, you do know how to hunt any prey. Tell me how to approach the admiral!
That's not enough to impress an admiral.
No, I don't.
What do you mean? How does one impress an admiral? What should my approach be?
Wait, that's your whole plan?
Well... yes. I've kept it simple, so as not to upset the admiral. How... how do you think I should approach the admiral?
Don't hide behind reports and applications. Meet him personally.
Face-to-face.
Make the admiral come to you, show your power.
Make him come here.
Talk to him like the job's already yours.
Show him your strength.
Interesting. Don't simply offer my name up to the admiral as "a" choice to replace Colonel Sartius; make myself "the" choice.
If things got bad enough here, Admiral Ivernus would want to conduct another inspection. That could be my opportunity to meet and impress him.
So back to work, then?
I'd suggest a hasty retreat after killing the Colicoid queen. Not that I'm telling you your business.
Your next assignment concerns the local fauna. Colonel Sartius is responsible for keeping our citizenry safe from the deadly Colicoids infesting this planet.
Never heard of these "Colicoids" before.
Colicoids?
Deadlier than a bunch of killer droids?
Hope they're a challenge.
I like deadly.
Colicoids are vicious, giant insect-like creatures that devour anything in their path. Their exact origin on Balmorra is unclear.
After the Empire's invasion, the Balmorrans released mutated Colicoids into the wilderness. The creatures successfully bred and have become a plague on the population.
The Colicoids have become almost docile in recent months. Attacks are down all across the planet.
That makes Colonel Sartius look like he's got this plague under control. But we know better, don't we?
You want to stir up these creatures. Make them angry.
I see where you're going.
Precisely! The only thing to do with docile Colicoids is make them hostile.
What should we replace the Colicoids with, Kowakian monkey-lizards?
Want to dream up a new plague?
The Colicoids are perfectly useful beasts. They simply need encouragement.
I'm not interested in guessing games, Pirrell. What's your plan?
You do, anyway.
Simple. If docile Colicoids are the problem, then we must strive to make them hostile again.
The last time they attacked in force was when a survey team accidentally encountered a Colicoid queen. It took five squads to kill her.
I'll need to know what tools to take for the job.
Tell me about the target.
Just get me a crate of thermal detonators, and I'll squash this bug for you.
It's demolishing time.
Too many explosions will attract attention from the military. We can't have that.
Place this sonic device near the nest entrance. It will confuse and anger the Colicoids. Kill any drones and warriors you see.
Eventually, the queen will reveal herself. The sonic device will disorient her, leveling the playing field so you get a fair shot. Be fast and careful.
Welcome back. I take it everything went well, and the Okara Droid Factory is... running smoothly.
What about Zalia? I trust that slicer won't be a problem?
What slicer, Lieutenant Major?
Job was done to spec.
Ah yes. What slicer indeed?
It's like she never even existed.
She's gone for good.
The slicer was just another unfortunate casualty of war.
Zalia had an accident.
The admiral will soon see my worth.
Master is so wise!
Remain silent, my pet, or I shall discipline you again. And you don't want that, do you?
Here is your payment for taking care of the slicer, my friend. Excellent work.
I hope Zalia cooperates with you. I'm sure you'll persuade her.
My apologies for the poor welcome. I never informed that idiot droid I was hiring a bounty hunter.
I'm assistant to the naval attache of the governor of Balmorra. I specialize in intelligence gathering.
Master is wise and powerful.
This is Murghir--an amusing gift from a friend on Dromund Kaas. What she lacks in intelligence she makes up for in entertainment value.
Let's get down to business, shall we?
My superior, Colonel Sartius, is an incompetent fool. I toil in his shadow, though his job should rightfully be mine.
I kill him, you get a promotion.
You want him eliminated.
If only it were that simple. Unfortunately, my superior is popular with the right people.
You're obviously more deserving of power.
That's a shame.
Precisely! Even you can see it.
That's quite an ego you have.
I have served this Empire with distinction for years--and yet I'm still merely a lieutenant major. Unacceptable.
But what's most infuriating is that Colonel Sartius has the full confidence of Admiral Ivernus.
Colonel Sartius remains in power because he excels at hiding his gross incompetence from the admiral. But we're going to tear down that facade.
The colonel loses his job, Admiral Ivernus comes here and gives you a promotion.
Then the admiral turns to you.
We're going to work well together, I can tell.
How will we do that?
I've been plotting Sartius's downfall for months--all I need is you to put my plan in motion.
The admiral may be protecting Sartius for his own reasons.
What if the admiral likes him?
Unlikely. Admiral Ivernus doesn't tolerate failure from his subordinates. He executes failures.
I want you to create "problems" for Colonel Sartius. Problems I'm confident he can't deal with.
Your missions will involve plenty of mayhem and destruction, and the pay is quite generous. Interested?
Mayhem and destruction are my specialties.
It's a job I know how to do.
Then it was fate that led you here.
"Generous pay" is my favorite term.
You said the magic words.
Excellent. We speak the same language, then.
If I wasn't, I'd already be gone.
I'm here, aren't I?
Indeed. Then let's discuss specifics.
Your first target is the Okara Droid Factory. Before the Empire invaded Balmorra, we sabotaged the facility, turning the droids into crazed killing machines.
Colonel Sartius is very close to deciphering the facility's control codes. If he does, it will bring the droids fully under the Empire's control.
The colonel cannot be allowed such a victory. I sent a data slicer to enter a code-scrambling virus into the facility's computer system.
Why do you need me?
Very sneaky, Lieutenant Major.
Clever.
Yes, I was rather proud of that plan myself. Unfortunately it didn't work.
Slicers usually avoid going into danger zones alone.
Brave slicer.
This slicer's bravery was bolstered by a large pile of credits--and a full security team.
The security team escorting the slicer was killed by the facility's droids. Now, the slicer is trapped inside.
The slicer refuses to input the virus until I send a rescue team. I'm sending you.
The slicer's name is Zalia. Force her to input the virus into the system, then eliminate her. No loose ends.
We'll have more business to discuss when you return.
I'm a very busy man. Speak to my protocol droid if you want an appointment.
Go and alert planetary security! Move!
What happened to the people who found this nest?
And the survey team?
One of them managed to crawl back, despite losing both legs. That's how I heard about it.
One of my survey teams located a new Colicoid nest in Bugtown, complete with a vicious queen. I want you to kill her.
One of my gracious master's scout units had the misfortune of discovering a new Colicoid nest while sweeping resistance hideouts.
The... unlucky scout who managed to crawl back raved about a bloodthirsty creature I've determined to be a queen. You see where this is going?
Clear as day.
Attacking the queen conventionally would be suicide, but my... ever thoughtful master had me devise something to assist you.
